title: YouTube TV‚Äôs Disney drama just got some users a $60 apology
summary: Users on Reddit report getting a $10 monthly credit for the next six months after losing Disney channels.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR YouTube TV is reportedly offering users a $10 monthly credit for six months following the recent removal of over 20 Disney channels from the platform. Last week, YouTube promised a $20 credit to affected users. Not everyone is seeing the new discount, however, and YouTube has not officially informed users about it. YouTube TV is apparently offering users a $10 monthly credit for six months to compensate for the recent loss of over 20 Disney channels .

title: AYANEO teases its first gaming phone with the soul of a handheld
summary: Featuring dual rear cameras and possible shoulder buttons: This is the AYANEO Phone.
body: TL;DR AYANEO has started teasing the launch of its first smartphone. The company says ‚Äúmobile phone meets the soul of gaming handheld‚Äù in its upcoming device. It appears that the AYANEO Phone will feature a dual-camera setup at the back and shoulder buttons. Gaming handheld maker AYANEO has begun teasing its first smartphone. The company posted the above teaser video of the AYANEO Phone on YouTube over the weekend, calling it ‚Äúa mobile phone truly made for gamers‚Äù with the ‚Äúsoul of a gaming handheld.‚Äù While the brief video doesn‚Äôt show us much of the phone, we do get a glimpse of it from the back. The dual camera setup stands out most clearly in the image (we‚Äôve increased the brightness for a better look below), but upon closer inspection, it appears that the AYANEO Phone could feature shoulder buttons for horizontal gameplay.

title: Ariana Grande Wraps Filming ‚ÄòFocker In-Law,‚Äô Shares Behind-the-Scenes Photos & Message to¬†Cast
summary: She'll be in the fourth installment of the 'Meet the Parents' franchise with Ben Stiller, Robert De Niro, Owen Wilson, Teri Polo, Blythe Danner and Skyler Gisondo.
body: Ariana Grande ‘s time with the Fockers and Byrnes has come to a close. The singer/actress, who’s slated to appear in the John Hamburg-directed comedy Focker In-Law for Universal, shared a sweet message to her co-stars and photos from the set of the film on Instagram Friday (Oct. 31). The movie, which will be in theaters on Nov. 25, 2026, is the fourth installment of the Meet the Parents franchise. “these past few months have been so, so unimaginably special. i love my Fockers, and i love my Byrnes‚Ä¶ so, so very much. i will miss this bunch terribly. see you next november!” Grande wrote on Friday. Snapshots from set include a picture of her hugging actor Ben Stiller, who returns as Greg Focker, and glimpses at a dressing room and chair with her character’s name, Olivia Jones. Robert De Niro, Owen Wilson, Teri Polo, Blythe Danner and Skyler Gisondo round out the cast. Though most details remain under wraps, The Hollywood Reporter says that “one plot point centers on the son of Stiller and Polo‚Äôs characters, who gets engaged to a ball-busting woman who seems all wrong for him.” Sources told THR that Grande will play the fianc√©e. The first thre‚Ä¶

title: Cardi B Cheers On Boyfriend Stefon Diggs at Patriots-Falcons Game
summary: The rapper, who's expecting a child with the Patriots wide receiver, made her first public appearance at one of Diggs' NFL games Sunday (Nov. 2).
body: Cardi B made an appearance at Gillette Stadium on Sunday (Nov. 2), a month-and-a-half after revealing she’s expecting a baby with football player Stefon Diggs, wide receiver for the New England Patriots. The rapper was spotted seated next to Robert Kraft as the Patriots played the Atlanta Falcons in Foxborough, Mass. Related A Timeline of Cardi B & Stefon Diggs’ Relationship Brandi Carlile Returns to 'SNL' to Perform Songs From 'Returning to Myself' Jessica Simpson Marks 8 Years of Sobriety: 'Alcohol Silenced My Intuition' In videos from the NFL game, Cardi’s seen standing at her seat and cheering, with a wide grin on her face — and looking chic in burgundy leather from Bottega. Cardi and Diggs made their relationship Instagram official in June, and the Am I the Drama? artist announced her pregnancy in September while promoting her new album. The baby on the way is their first together, and joins Cardi’s children Kulture, Blossom and Wave (with her ex, Offset) and Diggs’ daughter Nova. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm excited,‚Äù Cardi said on CBS Mornings . ‚ÄúI‚Äôm happy. I feel like I‚Äôm in a good space. I feel very strong. I feel very po‚Ä¶

title: Taylor Swift, The Beatles, Elvis & More Artists With the Most Weeks at No. 1 on the Billboard 200: Full¬†List
summary: Swift is the top solo artist on the list, and the top American artist.
body: By holding at No. 1 on the Billboard 200 (dated Nov. 8) for a fourth week with The Life of a Showgirl , Taylor Swift ups her career total of weeks at No. 1 on that chart to 90 ‚Äì a tally topped by only one act in the chart‚Äôs 69-year history. The Beatles amassed 132 weeks at No. 1 between 1964 and 2001, giving them a comfortable, 42-week lead over Swift, but at the rate she‚Äôs going, she may eventually equal or surpass them. Swift is already the top solo artist on our list of acts with the most weeks at No. 1 on the Billboard 200, and the top American artist. She first topped the Billboard 200 in November 2008 with Fearless , which went on to win the Grammy for album of the year. A few quick notes: While Elvis Presley ‚Äôs feats on the Billboard Hot 100 are shortchanged by the fact that his breakthrough in 1956 pre-dated the launch of  Billboard ‚Äôs flagship songs chart by more than two years, the Billboard 200 captures Presley‚Äôs entire career. His debut album,  Elvis Presley , entered the chart at No. 11 in the issue dated March 31, 1956 ‚Äì which was the chart‚Äôs second week. If you count the  Saturday Night Fever  soundtrack (which logged 24 weeks at No. 1 in 1978) a‚Ä¶

title: Taylor Swift‚Äôs ‚ÄòThe Life of a Showgirl‚Äô Spends First Month at No. 1 on Billboard¬†200
summary: Plus, Daniel Caesar, Brandi Carlile and Demi Lovato debut in the top 10.
body: Taylor Swift ‚Äôs The Life of a Showgirl spends its first month atop the Billboard 200 chart, as it racks up its fourth straight week at No. 1 (on the chart dated Nov. 8). It earned 146,000 equivalent album units (down 25%) in the United States in the week ending Oct. 30, according to Luminate. The Life of a Showgirl is only the second album in 2025 to spend its first month at No. 1, following Morgan Wallen‚Äôs I‚Äôm the Problem (which spent its first eight weeks atop the list, of its total 12 at No. 1). Swift‚Äôs own The Tortured Poets Department spent its first 12 weeks at No. 1 in 2024, of its total 17 weeks atop the list. With The Life of a Showgirl spending a fourth week at No. 1, Swift adds her 90th career week at No. 1 on the chart, extending her record among soloists . Elvis Presley has the second-most among soloists, with 67. The total encompasses her 15 No. 1 albums, the most among soloists. Only The Beatles have more weeks at No. 1 (132) and more No. 1 albums (19) among all artists. Also in the top 10 of the latest Billboard 200, new releases from Daniel Caesar, Brandi Carlile and Demi Lovato all debut. The Billboard 200 chart ranks the most popular albums of the week in the U.‚Ä¶

title: 5 smartwatches you should buy instead of the Google Pixel Watch 4
summary: The Pixel Watch 4 is outstanding, but so are these alternatives.
body: The Google Pixel Watch 4 is an outstanding smartwatch. In fact, you could argue that it‚Äôs the best Wear OS watch released this year. With its new Acuta 360 display, longer battery life, improved repairability, and excellent Gemini integration, it‚Äôs about as complete a package as you could ask for. Although we strongly recommend buying the Pixel Watch 4, it‚Äôs worth reminding that it isn‚Äôt your only option if you‚Äôre currently smartwatch shopping. In fact, there are still a lot of other great watches you should consider.

title: I didn‚Äôt care about my phone‚Äôs camera specs, but 5 things changed that
summary: I wasn't always a smartphone camera snob.
body: There are certain smartphone features I never compromise on , and one of these is specific camera criteria. However, things weren‚Äôt always this way, and there was a time when I focused more on other aspects ‚Äî such as whether I liked the phone‚Äôs design or the brand itself. So what changed? Here are a few of the things that made me start caring more about my smartphone camera than I used to.

title: The Pixel 10 Pro‚Äôs new voice typing is wild, and it‚Äôs changed how I use my phone
summary: No hands necessary.
body: I started using Google‚Äôs Gboard keyboard long before I made the switch to Android. Even as a third-party keyboard on an iPhone , I found it better than the native iOS typing experience. With Gboard on Android ‚Äî and more specifically on its own Pixel devices ‚Äî Google has consistently added new features and to this day, I consider it best in class (don‚Äôt ask me to use an iOS keyboard, please). The single most impressive feature of Gboard, however, doesn‚Äôt involve tapping on the keys. Instead, I opt for voice typing whenever possible, and Gboard‚Äôs voice typing has been good for so long that it‚Äôs easy to take for granted. But Google just one-upped itself in a major way with a brand new voice typing command that absolutely blew my mind: you can now edit your text with the sound of your voice, and it works incredibly well. From voice typing novice to Gboard power user

title: Brandi Carlile Returns to ‚ÄòSNL‚Äô to Perform Songs From ‚ÄòReturning to¬†Myself‚Äô
summary: This marks Carlile‚Äôs fourth time as musical guest on SNL and her second appearance this year, following an April duet with Elton John.
body: Brandi Carlile returned to Saturday Night Live on Nov. 2 with a commanding performance of ‚ÄúChurch & State‚Äù and ‚ÄúHuman,‚Äù both from her newly released solo album Returning to Myself . This marks Carlile‚Äôs fourth time as musical guest on SNL and her second appearance this year, following an April duet with Elton John promoting their joint project Who Believes in Angels? . On Saturday‚Äôs show, she took center stage solo, delivering two emotionally charged performances. Opening with ‚ÄúChurch & State,‚Äù Carlile sang of a ‚Äúfailing empire‚Äù and sociopolitical unrest in a haunting arrangement co-written with producer Andrew Watt and longtime collaborators Phil and Tim Hanseroth. She followed with ‚ÄúHuman,‚Äù a soaring ballad that reflects on vulnerability and resilience ‚Äî also the name of her upcoming Human Tour, which kicks off in February 2026. The two songs are from Carlile‚Äôs eighth studio album, Returning to Myself , released Oct. 25. It marks her first solo LP since 2021‚Äôs In These Silent Days , which peaked at No. 11 on the Billboard 200, topped the Rock and Americana/Folk charts, and won multiple Grammy awards, including Best Americana Album and awards for ‚ÄúBroken Horses.‚Äù It also ‚Ä¶

title: Jessica Simpson Marks 8 Years of Sobriety: ‚ÄòAlcohol Silenced My Intuition‚Äô
summary: ‚Äú8 years ago today I made the choice to confront, to confess and to let go of the self-sabotaging parts of my life that I was choosing,‚Äù Simpson wrote.
body: Jessica Simpson is celebrating eight years of sobriety. The singer, fashion entrepreneur and reality TV personality marked the milestone on Friday (Nov. 1) with a reflective Instagram post , sharing how giving up alcohol transformed her life and creativity. ‚Äú8 years ago today I made the choice to confront, to confess and to let go of the self-sabotaging parts of my life that I was choosing,‚Äù Simpson wrote. ‚ÄúMaking that decision allowed me to fully live in the pursuit of God‚Äôs purpose for my life. Alcohol silenced my intuition, blocked my dreams and chased my circulating fears of complacency.‚Äù She continued, ‚ÄúToday I am clear. Today I am driven by faith. Both fear and faith are something that we feel and may not see, I‚Äôm so happy I chose faith over fear. It was not in the fight that I found my strength, it was in the surrender.‚Äù View this post on Instagram A post shared by Jessica Simpson (@jessicasimpson) The ‚ÄúWith You‚Äù singer has been open about her journey to sobriety since revealing in her 2020 memoir Open Book that she quit drinking in 2017. Earlier this year, Simpson told The Cut that getting sober also reshaped her songwriting process. ‚ÄúEvery time I would write, I was a litt‚Ä¶

title: Tame Impala Resurrects ‚ÄòSundown Syndrome‚Äô at Halloween Barclays¬†Show
summary: Comedian and longtime Tame Impala fan Eric Andre made an unexpected cameo.
body: Tame Impala pulled a few tricks‚Äîand fan-favorite treats‚Äîout of the vault on Halloween night in Brooklyn. Related 6 Best Moments From Tame Impala’s Deadbeat Tour Opener in Brooklyn Brandi Carlile Returns to 'SNL' to Perform Songs From 'Returning to Myself' Jessica Simpson Marks 8 Years of Sobriety: 'Alcohol Silenced My Intuition' Kevin Parker brought his Deadbeat Tour to Barclays Center on Thursday (Oct. 31), performing the live rarity ‚ÄúSundown Syndrome‚Äù for the first time in seven years. The psych-pop gem, originally released as Tame Impala‚Äôs debut single in 2009, hadn‚Äôt appeared on a tour setlist since 2018. The moment came midway through night three of a four-night sold-out run at the arena, with Parker and his touring band all dressed in costumes nodding to Parker‚Äôs ‚Äúscarf-era‚Äù aesthetic from the early 2010s. The Halloween chaos didn‚Äôt stop there. Comedian and longtime Tame Impala fan Eric Andre made an unexpected cameo‚Äîinside the show‚Äôs bathroom cam. Parker has famously included a backstage toilet feed on tour to give fans a surreal behind-the-scenes moment mid-set. This time, Andre took over the screen, sharing a quick on-camera kiss w‚Ä¶

title: Travis Barker Celebrates Son Rocky‚Äôs 2nd¬†Birthday
summary: "Guitars, drums, pirates, boom boom pow and Angus Young forever," Barker wrote.
body: Travis Barker and Kourtney Kardashian are feeling the love this Halloween weekend as their youngest son, Rocky Thirteen , turned two. The Blink-182 drummer marked his son‚Äôs birthday on Saturday (Nov. 1) with a heartfelt Instagram tribute, posting a photo of Rocky wearing a backwards cap and a black jersey with the number ‚Äú13‚Äù on it. ‚ÄúHappy Birthday my Rocky 13 üñ§. You‚Äôre such a special soul, and you make every day brighter. I love you,‚Äù Barker wrote. ‚ÄúNo one‚Äôs cooler. Guitars, drums, pirates, boom boom pow and Angus Young forever üé∏ü•Åüè¥‚Äç‚ò†Ô∏èü•ä,‚Äù he added in the post, which received thousands of likes and birthday messages ‚Äî including a comment from Khlo√© Kardashian: ‚ÄúHappy birthday to the cutest!!!!! Rocky!!!!!!! ü©µü©µü©µ.‚Äù Rocky was born in November 2023, marking the first child together for Kardashian and Barker, who tied the knot in 2022. The couple introduced their son publicly in December of that year with a joint Instagram post simply captioned, ‚ÄúROCKY üñ§.‚Äù Last year, Rocky also received an unforgettable gift: a handwritten birthday letter from Rocky star Sylvester Stallone himself. ‚ÄúOne of the most special Birthday gifts,‚Äù Travis wrote on Instagram Stories on Nov. 4, 2024, alon‚Ä¶

body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rib6xSD7Ilk This week, Mishaal Rahman and C. Scott Brown discuss the upcoming addition of home screen widgets to Android Auto, a new ‚ÄúMin Mode‚Äù in Android 17 that could revolutionize the always-on display for apps like Google Maps, and the disappointing gaming performance of the Pixel 10. The Authority Insights Podcast is a new weekly show from the Android Authority team hosted by Mishaal Rahman and C. Scott Brown. In each episode, we‚Äôll break down the latest exclusive reports, app teardowns, and leaks from the Android Authority team.

title: Verizon is in crisis: Here‚Äôs what its new CEO must do to turn things around
summary: Verizon promises big changes, but does it actually have a plan?
body: Recently, I reported that AT&T, T-Mobile, and Verizon had all released their Q3 2025 financial results. Verizon‚Äôs rivals are doing well, but Big Red finds itself in a much less rosy position. While it did manage to add more than 40,000 new subscribers this quarter, those gains came entirely from its prepaid and business divisions. Its postpaid phone service actually lost 7,000 subscribers during this period. With T-Mobile edging ever closer to surpassing Verizon‚Äôs total subscriber count, it‚Äôs clear big changes are needed if Verizon wants to turn this ship around. Verizon‚Äôs new CEO, Dan Schulman, insists the company is working hard to do just that, and that it will ‚Äúno longer be the hunting ground for competitors looking to gain share‚Äù.

title: The Pixel 10 Pro is the Pixel I‚Äôve always wanted Google to make
summary: The Pixel 10 Pro atones for the sins of Pixels' past to become my ideal smartphone.
body: I find it hard to believe we‚Äôve had ten generations of Pixel already. The event for the original Pixel in October 2016 is still vivid in my mind ‚Äî I‚Äôd never been as excited for a phone as I was in that moment, and I haven‚Äôt felt that excitement since, either. As enamored by the Pixel as I was, I stopped using Pixels for over six years, and with good reason. The Pixel 10 Pro , though, is the phone I‚Äôve been waiting for Google to make. What went wrong If I used to be so excited about the Pixel, you may wonder when and why that stopped. Well, by the time the Pixel 3 arrived, the honeymoon period had ended. My time with the early Pixels was plagued with defective phones and issues I‚Äôd grown tired of. My Pixel XL, 2 XL, and 3 XL all had to be swapped on warranty at least three times, and the Pixel 3 XL made things worse by being a frustrating device even when it was working as intended.

title: Here‚Äôs how you can score a Mint Mobile plan for just $10 per month
summary: We've got a limited-time promo code that can save you 30% on the already cheap 12-month plans.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority Mint Mobile has made a name for itself as one of the most recognizable prepaid carriers in the US, thanks in part to Ryan Reynolds‚Äô ads and its simple approach to mobile plans. It runs on the T-Mobile network, but as an MVNO, it already undercuts the big three networks by a wide margin. However, a new offer that you won‚Äôt see advertised on the site makes its 12-month plans even cheaper. For a limited time, new customers can get 30% off all 12-month fixed-data plans using the code YEAROFMINT . That drops the 5GB plan from $15 to $10.50 per month, paid upfront for the year. The code should automatically apply if you use this link or widget below, but it‚Äôs worth noting down just in case.

title: Samsung is working on a follow-up to its best mid-ranger of 2025
summary: The Samsung Galaxy A57 is in development.
body: TL;DR The Samsung Galaxy A57‚Äôs model number has reportedly been spotted on Samsung‚Äôs firmware test servers. That would confirm that the unannounced phone is currently in development. This year‚Äôs Galaxy A56 came to the US months after international release. We have no release timeline for the A57. Samsung‚Äôs Galaxy A56 is a capable mid-ranger that made its way to the US months after its international release . We liked it quite a bit ‚Äî in fact, our own Zac Kew-Denniss said it‚Äôs a better value than the Galaxy S25 . Now, there‚Äôs apparent confirmation that the A56‚Äôs sequel is currently in development. User Koram_Akhilesh posted screenshots on Twitter (spotted by SamMobile ) purportedly showing that the Galaxy A57‚Äôs firmware has been found on Samsung‚Äôs test servers, identified by model number SM-A576B.

title: Poll: What channels would make you cancel YouTube TV if they disappeared?
summary: Six media companies control over 50 of the channels you watch on YouTube TV.
body: YouTube TV is the market leader in live TV streaming, with the most popular, and one of the most expensive , subscription services. The platform is estimated to have more than 10 million subscribers, and costs $83 per month. The high price understandably results in consumer frustration when major channels disappear from YouTube TV during negotiations ‚Äî something that has already happened multiple times in 2025. This time, YouTube TV fans are noticing that all Disney content is unavailable as of October 30 , when their contract expired. A whopping 21 channels immediately disappeared from the platform, including big names like ABC, ESPN, and National Geographic. You might not know that most of your favorite channels are consolidated under just a few media companies. That means when YouTube TV fails to reach a deal with the largest brands, an entire chunk of channels go dark.

title: Boom or bubble? Google wants to help you beat the market
summary: A little Google assistance might be just what your portfolio needs.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google Finance beta adds live earnings calls, transcripts, and AI summaries. You can browse an earnings calendar and compare company results in real time. It‚Äôs available now in the US as part of Google‚Äôs wider Finance revamp. The US stock market is flying high right now, but some experts are ringing alarm bells. NVIDIA and other AI giants continue to smash records, while nervous analysts warn that all the hype could come crashing down. If you‚Äôre trying to stay one step ahead of the next swing in sentiment, Google‚Äôs latest tool might come in handy. The company has added a new earnings experience to the Google Finance beta, bringing live audio streams, instant transcripts, and AI-powered summaries that explain the key takeaways from company results. It‚Äôs the latest addition to the redesigned Finance page that Google began testing in August.

title: PSA: Don‚Äôt toss away your old Nest Thermostat yet ‚Äî it just got thrown a lifeline
summary: Your first/second-gen Nest Learning Thermostat still has life.
body: TL;DR Earlier this year, Google announced it would end support for the first- and second-generation Nest Learning Thermostat on October 25, 2025. These thermostats can still be used, but you can no longer control them remotely, receive notifications, check the status in the Nest or Home app, or change settings from a mobile device. One Reddit user says they‚Äôre building a website/local server to restore these functions, and they may even build a mobile app if there‚Äôs enough traction. One of the biggest flaws with the concept of smart homes is planned obsolescence. That‚Äôs exactly what happened to the first- and second-generation Nest Learning Thermostat last week. But don‚Äôt throw your thermostat away just yet. It can still be used, and it may not stay dumb for long. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Did you watch YouTube growing up? You may be entitled to compensation
summary: If you were 13 or younger and watched YouTube between 2013 and 2020, you just might have a few bucks coming your way.
body: TL;DR A 2019 class-action suit against Google and YouTube was settled for $30 million. The suit accused Google and YouTube of collecting identifying information about minors without parental consent. Affected users are now able to file claims to potentially receive a portion of the $30 million settlement. Kids watch a lot of YouTube. Google‚Äôs keenly aware of that: It offers a version of the YouTube app that‚Äôs explicitly made for children‚Äôs content in YouTube Kids, and earlier this year, rolled out a controversial AI-based age estimation system to automatically flag accounts that may be used by minors. These measures are meant in part to help Google avoid legal trouble ‚Äî like a 2019 class-action suit filed in California accusing Google and YouTube of violating privacy laws by collecting information about minors for the purposes of advertising. The suit was eventually settled for a sum of $30 million, and now, according to Top Class Actions , affected users are able to submit claims to get a cut of that settlement.

title: Govee‚Äôs colorful new smart plug could replace your power strip and lamp
summary: A compact 8-in-1 power hub with built-in lighting for your smart home.
body: Credit: Amazon TL;DR Govee just launched its new Smart Plug Outlet Extender, which combines six outlets, two USB ports, and an RGB night light in one wall-mounted hub. Two smart outlets can be controlled via app or voice, while the rest remain always on. The device is priced at $36.99 with a 5% coupon currently available on Amazon. Govee‚Äôs latest smart home gadget is a little more colorful than most power strips. The company has launched the new Goveelife Smart Plug Outlet Extender, a compact hub that combines six outlets, two USB ports , and an integrated RGB night light in a single wall-mounted unit. It‚Äôs now available to buy in the US for $36.99. The device went on preorder earlier in the week and is now listed on Amazon, where a 5% coupon brings the price down to roughly $35. The 8-in-1 extender includes two app-controlled smart outlets on the front, while the four always-on outlets sit along the sides ‚Äî giving you three plug-in surfaces in total. There‚Äôs also a USB-C and a USB-A port. Govee says the sockets are spaced to fit bulkier adapters without blocking each other, which is a common complaint associated with poorly designed power strips.

title: Google may have learned from its irksome Maps mistake on Android Auto
summary: Second time's the charm: Google tests centered Android Auto maps without obstructing view.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR Some Android Auto users are reporting that Google Maps is centering the map again. Unlike last time, the destinations menu is not blocking a portion of the map. Remember earlier this year when an update centered the map in Google Maps on Android Auto? Well, the app is starting to do it again. However, this time, users may find it to be a welcome change rather than an irksome update. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: 2026 needs to be the year Samsung fixes the Galaxy Z Flip‚Äôs cover screen
summary: I want an app drawer and much, much more.
body: It sounds like Samsung has some pretty big plans for 2026 ‚Äî that‚Äôs great. I‚Äôm excited by the idea of new cameras, a custom chipset, and renewed innovation in its foldable lineup. However, this all sounds like stuff we‚Äôve heard before. We‚Äôve seen Samsung adopt a 200MP primary sensor, tack the For Galaxy badge onto Qualcomm‚Äôs latest chipset, and expand the Galaxy Z Flip‚Äôs cover screen beyond its weird, folder-shaped limits. So, for any of these new promises to actually make an impact in 2026, I need just one thing out of Samsung: I need it to fix the Galaxy Z Flip 8‚Äôs cover screen. I know I‚Äôve been asking for it for years, but here‚Äôs what needs to happen now.

title: Are you going to keep YouTube TV? [Poll]

title: Bose QuietComfort Ultra headphones drop to record-low price, saving you a whole $100
summary: Block out all the noise while saving a good chunk of change.
body: Credit: SoundGuys.com The world can be a noisy place, especially if you dwell in a busy city. The Bose QuietComfort Ultra headphones are still the best, and they effectively mute all that noise; they are also available at a very nice discount today. They are at a record-low price, saving you a whole $100! Buy the Bose QuietComfort Ultra headphones for just $329 ($100 off)

title: Why your cheap lens protector might be holding back your photos
summary: Cheap versus premium lens protectors: do you really get what you pay for?
body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority Protecting our expensive new smartphone is a top priority for many of us, and online marketplaces are flooded with options, from cases to display protection . An increasingly popular product segment is camera lens protectors, which obviously make a lot of sense if you‚Äôve just spent over $1,000 on one of the best camera phones on the market. While sticking a cheap layer of plastic or even glass in front of your high-precision camera might help protect it from scratches, there‚Äôs a risk that it will lower the quality of the pictures you take. Not necessarily because a protector will defocus or blur your images ‚Äî something this close to the lens is unlikely to do that ‚Äî but even a very transparent, high-quality protective layer will slightly reduce the amount of light reaching the sensor. In the worst case, introducing impure optics may exacerbate issues like edge aberration and lens flare, or reduce the amount of detail captured. Not what you want from a top-tier camera phone.

title: YouTube Music on Wear OS shows signs of Material 3 Expressive revamp
summary: But, it looks like a job half-done!
body: Credit: Tushar Mehta / Android Authority TL;DR YouTube Music on Wear OS is getting new visual elements in line with Google‚Äôs Material 3 Expressive design. The redesign is live on the Wear OS tile as well as some other elements. However, the player interface is still using the older interface. Google has been working to bring its latest Material 3 Expressive aesthetics across multiple apps and interfaces. While Android phones have been the blessed recipients of the new design language, Google has also begun painting elements from the smaller screen with similar visuals. The Pixel Watch 4 is splattered with a healthy dose of the Expressive design, thanks to its Wear OS 6 interface . Meanwhile, Google has also been testing a design revamp for apps such as Maps , even on older versions of Wear OS. Apps, such as Google Calendar , Home, Keep, Messages , and Gemini for Watch , already have the updated visuals. Now, YouTube Music on Wear OS is getting a similar treatment.

title: A lot of you are very upset with Google‚Äôs Material 3 Expressive design choices
summary: There's no pleasing everybody!
body: Good interface design ‚Äî the kind that‚Äôs simultaneously intuitive, beautiful, responsive, and powerful ‚Äî is just so deceptively tricky to get right. Sure, it‚Äôs easy to complain about all the things we might not like about one particular UI, but there‚Äôs a big difference between being able to express some criticism and building something that everyone‚Äôs going to like. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: 5 changes the Galaxy S26 needs to win over frustrated fans
summary: Samsung has its work cut out for it with the Galaxy S26 series.
body: If you‚Äôre a Samsung fan, chances are you weren‚Äôt thrilled with this year‚Äôs Galaxy S25 series. It‚Äôs not that Samsung‚Äôs S25 phones are bad, but they‚Äôre some of the most tepid year-over-year upgrades we‚Äôve ever seen. Samsung‚Äôs hardware designs? Unchanged. Cameras? The same. Battery capacities and charging speeds? You already know the answer.

title: YouTube TV subscribers pay the price for its feud with Disney
summary: And all you might receive is a $20 credit.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR 20+ Disney-owned channels have been taken off YouTube TV after the two companies failed to renew licensing terms. The list includes several channels under ABC, ESPN, and Nat Geo labels, in addition to Disney‚Äôs. YouTube says it will refund subscribers $20 if the channels are off the network for too long. YouTube TV is already among the most expensive live digital TV services on offer in the US. And it‚Äôs about to pinch its subscribers a little more as it has failed to renew its deal with Disney. Following a public spat from last week , when YouTube accused Disney of arm-twisting it, the two parties have failed to negotiate a mutually beneficial deal. With this, more than 20 channels from Disney‚Äôs network, including multiple ABC, ESPN, and National Geographic channels, have been removed from the live TV platform.

title: Poll: Would you trade your TV for a Google TV projector?
summary: It could be time to give up the glow of your flat screen.
body: A TV is a staple in most households. They‚Äôre substantial, predictable, and perfectly happy to broadcast your comfort sitcom to the same couch you make your way to every night. Lately, though, projectors have been making a play for the spotlight (literally). Impressive new models with Google TV baked in are turning heads and, in some cases, vying to replace your TV. From pocket-sized companions like the XGIMI MoGo 4 to living room workhorses like BenQ‚Äôs GV32, the projector market is starting to redirect from hobbyist to mainstream consumers. Where do you land?

title: This leaked OnePlus flagship looks like a better bet than the OnePlus 15
summary: And could come with multiple upgrades over the current generation.
body: Credit: Aamir Siddiqui / Android Authority TL;DR OnePlus‚Äô next small phone just leaked, and it packs big upgrades. The OnePlus 15T is expected to feature a larger battery, an improved fingerprint scanner, and a new Snapdragon chipset. The sad part, though, is that OnePlus might not launch it in the US. The OnePlus 15 is peeking at us through the horizon. After launching in China this month , the phone is set to arrive globally next month with a mixed bag of upgrades and downgrades. Meanwhile, OnePlus is cooking another phone that could be all upgrades. Although it won‚Äôt arrive until next year, a leak has provided clarity about its tentative specifications. Leaker Digital Chat Station recently shared details about an upcoming small phone from OnePlus. Based on the screen size, we presume the leaker is discussing the successor to the OnePlus 13T, which launched globally as the OnePlus 13S . Therefore, it could be speculated to be called the OnePlus 15T or 15S, in line with the naming convention for the recently launched flagship.

title: Doomscrolling on the go? One UI 8.5 could help save your limited data plan (APK teardown)
summary: One UI 8.5's new "Adaptive Data Saver" will download social media videos only when you are ready to watch them.
body: Credit: Mishaal Rahman / Android Authority TL;DR Code within One UI 8.5 suggests Samsung could bring a new ‚ÄúAdaptive data saver‚Äù feature to Galaxy phones. The feature works by only downloading videos in social media apps when you are ‚Äúready to watch them.‚Äù This feature can help users with limited mobile data plans manage their social media data usage effectively. One UI 8.5 is expected to be a big update for Samsung Galaxy phones and tablets, in ways that One UI 8 wasn‚Äôt. We‚Äôre expecting plenty of new features, ranging from Pro camera presets and sharing to Galaxy S26 Ultra exclusive features like Private Display , and more. We‚Äôve now spotted another new feature in the works for One UI 8.5, and this one will likely be appreciated by people who don‚Äôt have unlimited data access all the time. title: US officials want to ban your Wi-Fi router for national security reasons
summary: Several US agencies have reportedly backed a proposal to impose a ban on the sale of TP-Link routers in the country.
body: Credit: Amazon TL;DR The Department of Commerce (DOC) has reportedly proposed a ban on the sales of TP-Link routers in the US. The proposal is reportedly backed by several federal agencies, including the Departments of Homeland Security, Justice, and Defense. The DOC is concerned that TP-Link routers pose a national security threat to the US, given the company‚Äôs Chinese origins. The US Department of Commerce (DOC) has floated a proposal against the sale and use of TP-Link products in the country, citing national security concerns.

title: Watch: Google and Magic Leap reveal fresh Android XR glasses prototype
summary: A renewed deal and a new demo hint at what Google‚Äôs XR future could look like.
body: Credit: Magic Leap TL;DR Google and Magic Leap showed a new Android XR glasses prototype at the FII event in Riyadh. The demo builds on earlier versions, such as Google Martha, showing Gemini identifying objects and offering real-time assistance. Magic Leap has extended its partnership with Google by three years and will act as an AR ecosystem partner, rather than a hardware maker. It‚Äôs only been a week since Samsung kicked off the Android XR era with its Galaxy XR headset , but Google‚Äôs already looking beyond bulky headsets to something much lighter. At the Future Investment Initiative (FII) event in Riyadh, Google and Magic Leap showed off a new Android XR glasses prototype ‚Äî the first time we‚Äôve seen Google concept glasses on stage since I/O in the summer. As reported by Android Central , the two companies also confirmed they‚Äôve extended their partnership for another three years. Magic Leap first teamed up with Google in 2024, combining its optics and manufacturing know-how with Google‚Äôs AI and display technology.

title: Nova Launcher gets surprise update following last month‚Äôs shutdown, but there‚Äôs a catch
summary: Nova Launcher rolls out an unexpected 8.1.3 update, but former developers say it is over a year old.
body: TL;DR Nova Launcher appeared to have shut down for good last month when its founder, Kevin Barry, left its parent company Branch Metrics. The launcher received a rare update on the Google Play Store today, its first since May 2024. The update includes new features and improved compatibility with newer Android versions, but its former developers say it‚Äôs over a year old. Nova Launcher, the popular alternative Android launcher that appeared to shut down last month , is getting an unexpected update. The launcher was sold to analytics firm Branch Metrics in 2022, but by 2024, the company underwent mass developer layoffs. Only Nova Launcher‚Äôs founder, Kevin Barry, remained working on the launcher until September 2025, when he too left Branch. Now, there‚Äôs a glimmer of hope Nova Launcher might not be completely dead yet. Nova Launcher users spotted an unexpected version 8.1.3 update roll out on the Google Play Store beta channel, according to a post on Reddit‚Äôs Nova Launcher sub from user colinaspinall . As of now, the latest update hasn‚Äôt appeared through the stable release channel, or Nova Launcher‚Äôs official beta website . While the update is a sign someone at Branch is paying attent‚Ä¶

title: Gboard is getting a new feature to help keep your GIF spam topical
summary: A new trending searches button is coming.
body: TL;DR Gboard is getting a button to browse trending GIF searches. These trending searches are apparently sourced from Tenor. The trending GIFs button isn‚Äôt live in any user-facing version of Gboard yet. Gboard is making it easier to find GIFs about buzzy topics. Experimenting with the latest beta version of Google‚Äôs software keyboard, we managed to enable a new button that opens a list of trending GIF search terms. We saw this new trending topics button in Gboard version 16.3.2.821569955-beta-arm64-v8a beta. As it exists now, the button ‚Äî a trend line pointing upward ‚Äî appears near the search bar in the keyboard‚Äôs GIF menu, next to the clock icon that opens your GIF history.

title: It‚Äôs official: Google‚Äôs Clock app is dropping support for non-Pixel smartwatches
summary: Google's Clock app is cutting off support for Samsung, OnePlus, and every other non-Pixel smartwatch.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Users who own a Wear OS smartwatch will no longer be able to download Google‚Äôs Clock app. Non-Pixel smartwatches that have the app already installed will be able to continue using the software, but won‚Äôt receive updates. Pixel smartwatches will come with the app already installed and will receive updates. Last month, we reported that Galaxy Watch and OnePlus Watch owners were noticing something strange about Google‚Äôs Clock app. The software was no longer available to install on the Play Store. Meanwhile, those with the app already installed pointed out that the app description in the Play Store listing said that their device was not supported. At the time, it was unclear if this was a bug or a sign of an incoming change. It turns out that the answer was the latter. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: YouTube TV reportedly has a big demand for Disney channels as deadline expires tonight
summary: With the clock ticking on YouTube TV‚Äôs deal with Disney, a new report reveals that Google‚Äôs streamer has at least one big demand for Disney. more‚Ä¶

title: Google Photos looks ready to finally solve its RAW backup problem
summary: Working with RAW images on Android could finally stop killing your cloud storage.
body: TL;DR Google Photos backs up RAW images alongside JPGs, which takes a lot of cloud storage. Earlier this year we found evidence for a new system that would store RAW images separately and not back them up. We‚Äôre now finally able to see this in action, and there‚Äôs even a toggle to opt in to backing up RAWs if you‚Äôve got the space. If you care even a little about photography, you probably know all about RAW images . While JPGs are convenient to post and share due to their relatively small file sizes, RAW files don‚Äôt just capture an image without lots of lossy compression, but they store camera sensor data before things like white balance are corrected, giving you tons of power to control what your final output will look like, even with the photo already taken. Despite all that potential, though, they‚Äôre not without their problems, and we‚Äôve been keeping an eye on one in particular concerning how Android handles them. title: Cellebrite leak highlights how much more secure Pixel phones are with GrapheneOS
summary: Turns out one of the Pixel‚Äôs best privacy upgrades doesn‚Äôt come from Google at all.
body: Credit: Calvin Wankhede / Android Authority TL;DR A leaked Cellebrite chart shows Pixel phones running GrapheneOS largely resist the company‚Äôs forensic unlocking tools. The leak came from a private Google Teams call that someone joined and screenshotted before posting on a GrapheneOS forum. Pixel devices running standard Android still allow limited data access before first unlock, but GrapheneOS versions appear to block it more effectively. Google Pixel phones already have a solid reputation for security, but leaked Cellebrite documents show they‚Äôre even harder to crack when running GrapheneOS , the privacy-focused Android alternative. Cellebrite builds the forensic tools law enforcement uses to get data from locked phones. As reported by 404 Media , the leak came from someone who managed to join a private Microsoft Teams call between Cellebrite staff and a prospective customer. During the meeting, the uninvited participant took screenshots of what appears to be an internal ‚ÄòAndroid OS Access Support Matrix‚Äô and then shared them on the GrapheneOS discussion forum .

title: Galaxy S22 phones in the US are getting their last major Android update
summary: No more pauses, please.
body: TL;DR Verizon support pages say that S22 series phones purchased from the carrier are now eligible to download One UI 8. Several comments on Reddit point to S22 phones also getting the update on AT&T. The rollout status of One UI 8 for unlocked S22 phones is unclear. One UI 8 has been making its way to Samsung phones in fits and starts for a few weeks now. The rollout has hit major milestone this week, with the Galaxy S22 series now receiving the update on multiple carriers in the US. Verizon has updated support pages for the Galaxy S22, S22+, and S22 Ultra to show that, starting today, each is eligible to download Android 16-based One UI 8 along with the October Android security patch. This comes after Samsung started and then paused One UI 8 distribution for international S22, S23, and S24 phones earlier this month.

title: AT&T is ready to go to court to defend its T-Mobile bashing ad
summary: The NAD ordered AT&T to remove promotional material that use its information last week.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR AT&T recently launched an ad campaign that uses the BBB National Programs‚Äô National Advertising Division findings to criticize T-Mobile for ‚Äúun-truths.‚Äù The NAD has ordered AT&T to remove the promotional material, which it says violates ad-industry rules. The carrier has now filed a complaint for declaratory relief against the self-regulatory body. You may have caught the commercial by now, where AT&T uses Luke Wilson to talk about T-Mobile as a ‚Äúmaster of breaking promises.‚Äù The commercial in question highlights the Un-Carrier‚Äôs deceptive ads and other transgressions. It‚Äôs maybe one of the most direct attacks AT&T has taken against a rival in a long time. Now AT&T is fighting for the right to keep its campaign up. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

summary: Do you have a desk full of wires? Clean it up with this deal!
body: Credit: Anker via Amazon Don‚Äôt you love those tidy desk setups you see online? I do too, but with so many devices, it is hard to handle cable management to that level. Here‚Äôs a way to minimize it. The Anker Prime Charger (200W, 6 Ports, GaN) is a desktop charger that minimizes clutter while saving you money, as it is currently 38% off. The M1 and M2 buttons have moved to the back, with pre-orders reopening soon. Retroid isn‚Äôt wasting any time fixing its most controversial product launch yet. Just a day after halting Pocket 6 pre-sales following fan criticism, the company has unveiled a redesigned version of the handheld. This time, it‚Äôs giving players a choice. summary: Get the specced-out version at a price that competes with competitors' base models.

title: How Android handles Hi-Res audio: An audiophile‚Äôs guide to the best sound
summary: Your smartphone might be the best music player you already own.
body: Credit: Tushar Mehta / Android Authority While there‚Äôs been a modest revival in dedicated audio players, most listeners ‚Äî including many discerning audiophiles ‚Äî are streaming music straight from their smartphones. And why not? Android devices offer a vast selection of music streaming platforms , surprisingly capable speakers, and some of the best Bluetooth connectivity around. Still, Android‚Äôs audio signal chain remains a bit of a black box. What actually happens to your music between the app and your headphone driver is often unclear. To lift the veil, here‚Äôs how Android handles your audio ‚Äî and what you can do to get the best possible sound.

title: A crucial data analysis feature is coming to NotebookLM very soon
summary: Along with the possibility to generate podcasts from your financial statements, because why not?
body: Credit: Andy Walker / Android Authority TL;DR Google has confirmed it is bringing Sheets support to NotebookLM ‚Äúvery soon.‚Äù This complements Docs and Slides support in NotebookLM. Sheets support is currently limited to NotebookLM Plus users, i.e., those who subscribe to Google‚Äôs AI Plus or AI Pro plans. NotebookLM is easily one of Google‚Äôs most highly cherished AI tools , with fewer haters than any other of Google‚Äôs apps. It lets you research and process data from numerous different sources and convert verbose formats into digestible chunks, or even AI-generated podcasts and video essays. With an upcoming update, Google is set to improve file support for free users. Google Drive integration already lets you import files from Docs and Slides as sources to NotebookLM. But the research tool lacks support for Google Sheets (or .XLS and .XLSX files) in the free tier. Thankfully, if you‚Äôve been yearning for the option to import your Sheets or Excel files to NotebookLM, Google may be bringing it to you soon.

title: T-Mobile is switching up how it handles payment arrangements
summary: T-Mobile now limits payment arrangements to the T-Life app, dropping in-store and phone options.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Starting today, T-Mobile will only allow payment arrangements through the T-Life app. In-store and customer support call options previously required a fee, but have now been discontinued entirely. The move continues T-Mobile‚Äôs shift away from traditional customer service channels as it consolidates all its functionality under the T-Life app. In the current economy, it‚Äôs easy to fall behind on your bills from time to time. The good news is that many utilities offer payment arrangements to help you pay off your overdue balance gradually, including cellular companies like T-Mobile . While you‚Äôll still technically be overdue and subject to extra fees, an arrangement ensures your account won‚Äôt be suspended while you work to bring your payment history up to date. For the Un-carrier, there have always been three ways to do this: via the app, in-store, or through a customer support call. According to a new report from The Mobile Report , all but one of these options is going away.

title: Spec leak for this Nintendo DS clone reveals exactly why it comes in at under $100
summary: The first affordable two-screen emulation handheld makes some major concessions.
body: TL;DR Specs for ANBERNIC‚Äôs upcoming RG DS have leaked via an AliExpress listing. It will have two 4-inch 640√ó480 screens and a Rockchip RK3568 SoC. Those screens won‚Äôt integer scale DS games, and the SoC is too weak for the MelonDS emulator. The dual-screen gaming handheld race already has two premium champions in the AYANEO Pocket DS and AYN Thor , but ANBERNIC‚Äôs more budget-friendly RG DS made big waves when it was announced earlier this month . Coming in at under $100, it was always the case that some concessions would need to be made. but a recent spec leak has dampened some of the community‚Äôs excitement. A listing from ANBERNIC‚Äôs AliExpress storefront was published online, and although it‚Äôs since been pulled, it revealed the full specs, size, and more. Starting with the screens, it will feature two 4-inch IPS screens with a resolution of 640√ó480. That‚Äôs a fairly limited resolution for screens this size, but the real issue is that it doesn‚Äôt support perfect integer scaling for DS games. Instead, it‚Äôs 2.5x, which can lead to some wonky visuals, especially in pixel art games.

title: You‚Äôre missing out on your Pixel 10‚Äôs best camera feature
summary: Don't sleep on the new and improved panorama mode!
body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority When Google announced the Pixel 10 series , a lot of focus was given to the new 100x Pro Res Zoom as the highlight camera feature, with Camera Coach taking the second seat. What went under the radar is Google‚Äôs continuous work on Panorama mode, which today is absolutely amazing and has finally reached its full potential. I‚Äôve been using my Pixel 10 Pro XL as my main camera for a couple of months, including a short trip to Athens and some sightseeing around France while my parents were visiting. Here‚Äôs what makes panorama mode amazing on this phone and why I think people are sleeping on it.

title: I‚Äôm a OnePlus fan, but the OnePlus 15 broke my heart
summary: This isn't the OnePlus phone I was hoping for.
body: I‚Äôm a big fan of OnePlus phones. From the day I got my invite to buy the OnePlus One to happily using the OnePlus 13 for much of 2025, OnePlus‚Äôs Android handsets have really resonated with me over the years. The company‚Äôs focus on smooth performance, long battery life, fast charging, unique hardware, and opinionated cameras are all things I value in an Android phone, and OnePlus has consistently delivered on them. And yet, with the OnePlus 15 , I find myself feeling rather conflicted. OnePlus did a lot right with the phone, and its commitment to performance, battery, and charging is more evident than ever. But at the same time, OnePlus sacrificed other parts of its identity to the point where I‚Äôm not even sure I recognize this as a OnePlus phone.

title: Google Maps is working on an extremely minimalist power saving mode
summary: Don't leave me stranded with no idea of where I'm going!
body: TL;DR Google Maps appears to be working on a new power saving mode for navigation. The mode would eliminate almost all UI elements and extraneous map labeling from your view. Power saving mode limitations could prevent it from working in landscape or with public transit. When is the absolute worst time for your phone to be running low on battery ? Halfway through filming your kid‚Äôs play? First thing in the morning when you realize you forgot to charge it overnight? While we could keep going for pretty much ever, high on that list would absolutely be ‚Äúwhen you‚Äôre in the middle of navigating somewhere.‚Äù Thankfully, Google Maps could soon offer a new mode for dealing with exactly those kind of emergencies. title: This budget E Ink smartphone delivers where the Palma 2 Pro falls short
summary: Bigme's latest is easy on the eyes and on the wallet.
body: TL;DR Bigme‚Äôs HiBreak S features a 5.84-inch E Ink display available in color and black-and-white variants. The device runs Android 14 with Google Play, dual-SIM, and 4G LTE support. It is priced at $249 for a monochrome model and $279 for a color model. Bigme has launched the HiBreak S, a device that blurs the line between smartphone and e-reader, all at an affordable price point. While BOOX‚Äôs new Palma 2 Pro looks the part but lacks full voice-calling support, the HiBreak S delivers connectivity and a starting price that makes it the most affordable color E Ink phone to date. The HiBreak S features a 5.84-inch Kaleido 3 color E Ink display, available in both color and black-and-white variants. The panel‚Äôs matte finish keeps reflections to a minimum, while a 36-level front light with adjustable color temperature makes it easy to read in any lighting. The E Ink technology naturally favors eye comfort and energy efficiency over motion smoothness, so users should expect crisp text and subdued colors rather than high-refresh visuals.

title: Samsung‚Äôs One UI 8.5 update makes quick settings pop with cleaner, glassier design
summary: But not as iOS-esque as some of the other One UI 8.5 features.
body: Credit: Sammobile TL;DR Samsung appears to have further reworked the Quick Settings panel in the latest One UI 8.5 build. The leak shows dark outlines outside Quick Settings tiles along with a subtle, glass-like interface. This adds to the list of features seemingly inspired by Apple‚Äôs latest design changes in iOS 26, though it‚Äôs not entirely the same. Samsung‚Äôs upcoming One UI 8.5 software for Galaxy smartphones and tablets is set to bring several significant design changes over the current UI. One of these is a refreshed Quick Settings panel, which is expected to become more dynamic and customizable with this future update. Although One UI 8.5 is likely to arrive alongside the Galaxy S26 series ‚Äî and the beta isn‚Äôt coming for the whole of November either, plenty of leaks have given us an overview of these design changes. While a revamped Quick Settings panel has already been spotted in previously leaked builds of One UI 8.5, the latest leak gives us a better look at additional options it could bring. Tipster Tarun Vats shared a screenshot of the updated panel on X, showing that quick settings tiles for various shortcuts now have a thin outline. This is predominantly visible when‚Ä¶

title: Google‚Äôs Halloween Doodle lets you play PAC-MAN in spooky style
summary: Go have some fun on the Google homepage today and tomorrow.
body: Credit: Google TL;DR Google is celebrating 45 years of PAC-MAN with a Halloween special playable Doodle. The new Google Doodle features eight levels, including four haunted-house mazes created in partnership with Bandai Namco. You can also grab a Power Pellet and turn the tables to chase the ghosts instead of running from them. Google is serving up some serious nostalgia today with a special PAC-MAN: Halloween 2025 Edition Doodle to celebrate 45 years of the classic game. And yes, it‚Äôs playable right on the Google homepage.
